blackjack.logic

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • blackjack.logic.Player
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AIPlayer, Dealer, HumanPlayer

    public abstract class Player
extends Object
    Player is an abstract class that represents a single player that can be either human- or AI-controlled.
    Author:
    Jari Avikainen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(String name, int id, int money)
      Generates a new Player using the given parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(String name,
              int id,
              int money)
        Generates a new Player using the given parameters. The players current bet is set to 0 and the player is generated a new empty hand of cards.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the player
        id - The id used for connecting the player to a proper playing are in the UI
        money - The money player has when starting the game

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentBet

        public int getCurrentBet()

      • getName

        public String getName()

      • getID

        public int getID()

      • getMoney

        public int getMoney()

      • addMoney

        public void addMoney(int amount)
        Adds the given amount of money to player.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount of money to be added. amount has to be positive.

      • takeMoney

        public void takeMoney(int amount)
        Removes the given amount of money from the player. If the player runs out of money, take the rest from player's current bet.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount of money to be removed. amount has to be positive

      • getHand

        public Hand getHand()

      • clearHand

        public void clearHand()
        Remove all cards from player's hand.

      • addCard

        public void addCard(Card card)
        Add the given card to the player's hand. Adding a null card does nothing.
        Parameters:
        card - The card to be added.

      • adjustBet

        public void adjustBet(int newBet)
        Updates the player's bet to the chosen amount. This will increase or decrease the amount of money the player has left by the difference between the previous bet and the chosen bet. Trying to increase the bet by more than the amount of money remaining does nothing. Classes extending Player may call this method using adjusted parameter.
        Parameters:
        newBet - The amount chosen for the next bet. This has to be more than zero.

      • setCurrentBet

        public void setCurrentBet(int bet)

      • isAI

        public abstract boolean isAI()
        Can be used to check whether the player is an AI or not in the sense that AI players are supposed to be able to play their hands independently.
        Returns:
        true, if the player is an AI and false, if the player is human-controlled.

      • isDealer

        public boolean isDealer()

      • playHand

        public abstract void playHand(Shoe shoe)
        Plays the current hand by taking more cards from the shoe until satisfied. The exact implementation depends on the type of player.
        Parameters:
        shoe - The shoe from which the new cards are taken.
